item.description:
Hungry for knowledge? The Factory Farming Awareness Coalition provides a holistic overview of the impacts of industrial animal agriculture on everything from climate change to social justice.

Our 40-minute presentation is a must-see for people who care about food, for people who care about people, and for people who love seeing cute animal pictures.

The Factory Farming Awareness Coalition is an educational non-profit dedicated to empowering people to save the environment, animals, and our own health through our daily food choices. Visit www.ffacoalition.org for more information and lucyparsons.org

If you can, please bring a vegan dish to share for the potluck!



Directions:

By train/public transportation: Take the Orange Line to the Jackson Square stop. Walk uphill on Centre St. for a minute or two. Lucy Parsons Center will be on the left just past Wyman Street.

By bus: Take the 39 bus to the corner of Centre and South Huntington. Keep going down Centre (the building numbers will get smaller). Lucy Parsons Center will be on the right just past Forbes.

From I-93 N or S: Take exit 18 toward Mass Ave/Andrew Square Keep right at the fork and merge onto Mass Ave Connector. Continue onto Melnea Cass Blvd. Turn left onto Shawmut Ave. Turn right onto Malcolm X Blvd. Turn left onto Columbus Ave. Take the 3rd right onto Centre St. The LPC will be on the left just past Wyman St.
item.name: Factory Farming Awareness & Vegan Potluck
